channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Mart√≠nez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: With funding deadline days away, lawmakers debate reforms to immigration enforcement
item.description: The clock is ticking for the Department of Homeland Security. The agency is days away from running out of funding, but Democrats and Republicans remain far apart on changes to immigration enforcement.
item.content:encoded: The clock is ticking for the Department of Homeland Security. The agency is days away from running out of funding, but Democrats and Republicans remain far apart on changes to immigration enforcement.
item.dc:creator: Claudia Grisales

item.title: Hakeem Jeffries calls for 'dramatic reform' at DHS
item.description: House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, D-N.Y., urges his GOP counterparts to "rein in" ICE and discusses his 10-point list of demands to do so.
item.content:encoded:
House Minority Leader Hakeem Jeffries, D-N.Y., urges his GOP counterparts to "rein in" ICE and discusses his 10-point list of demands to do so.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: U.S. and Iran to hold talks about Iran's nuclear program, Congress continues debate on immigration enforcement changes as funding deadline looms, FBI examines ransom notes in search for Nancy Guthrie.
item.content:encoded: U.S. and Iran to hold talks about Iran's nuclear program, Congress continues debate on immigration enforcement changes as funding deadline looms, FBI examines ransom notes in search for Nancy Guthrie.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: 'A party and a protest': What to expect from Bad Bunny on Super Bowl Sunday
item.description: Petra River-Rideau, co-author of the Bad Bunny Syllabus and the new book P FKN R, says the Puerto Rican artist often wields joy as resistance.
item.content:encoded:
Petra River-Rideau, co-author of the Bad Bunny Syllabus and the new book P FKN R, says the Puerto Rican artist often wields joy as resistance.

(Image credit: Mike Coppola/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Adriana Gallardo

item.title: DOJ admits redaction errors in Epstein docs while names in files face scrutiny
item.description: The Justice Department's latest release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein files has led to new scrutiny of powerful people in convicted sex offender's orbit.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department's latest release of files related to Jeffrey Epstein files has led to new scrutiny of powerful people in convicted sex offender's orbit.

(Image credit: Mariam Zuhaib)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: White House holds up funding for $16B transportation project in New York
item.description: A $16 billion transportation project in New York is in jeopardy unless the Trump administration relents. The Gateway project is building a new commuter rail tunnel between New York and New Jersey.
item.content:encoded: A $16 billion transportation project in New York is in jeopardy unless the Trump administration relents. The Gateway project is building a new commuter rail tunnel between New York and New Jersey.
item.dc:creator: Stephen Nessen

item.title: How beef made its way to the top of the food pyramid in the U.S.
item.description: The American diet has had a roller coaster relationship with beef, but new dietary guidelines from the U.S. government puts beef back on top of the food pyramid. How did it get there again?
item.content:encoded: The American diet has had a roller coaster relationship with beef, but new dietary guidelines from the U.S. government puts beef back on top of the food pyramid. How did it get there again?
item.dc:creator: Darian Woods

item.title: As some Democrats embrace calls to 'abolish ICE,' others seek more targeted reforms
item.description: A growing number of Democrats are embracing calls to "abolish ICE," but not everyone in the party sees it as a winning message.
item.content:encoded: A growing number of Democrats are embracing calls to "abolish ICE," but not everyone in the party sees it as a winning message.
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: 'La cosa': In Cuba, this single phrase carries coded truths
item.description: In Cuba, "la cosa" speaks louder than words. That single phrase carries the weight of daily struggle, coded truths and the country's unspoken realities.
item.content:encoded: In Cuba, "la cosa" speaks louder than words. That single phrase carries the weight of daily struggle, coded truths and the country's unspoken realities.
item.dc:creator: Eyder Peralta

item.title: Iran and U.S. to hold talks in Oman about Iran's nuclear program
item.description: The stakes are high as the U.S. and Iran begin negotiations Friday on Iran's nuclear program. If they can't reach a deal, President Trump could order a military strike.
item.content:encoded: The stakes are high as the U.S. and Iran begin negotiations Friday on Iran's nuclear program. If they can't reach a deal, President Trump could order a military strike.
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre
